title: Select Bajaj Pulsar models get discounts up to Rs 7,300
description: The Bajaj Pulsar range has crossed the 2 crore sales milestone across 50 countries and to celebrate this milestone, Bajaj is offering discounts of up to Rs 7,300 on selected models.  Pulsar 220F enjoys the highest price cut Pulsar N160 TD single seat price increased by Rs 1,000 Bajaj Pulsar hits 2 crore sales milestone Bajaj is offering discounts on select models The Bajaj Pulsar made its debut in 2001, revolutionizing India’s budget performance segment. It initially launched with 150cc and 180cc models, which were considered high-performance at the time, given that most other offerings ranged between 100-125cc. Over the years, the Pulsar lineup has grown significantly, and today, it boasts a diverse range of twelve models, spanning from 125cc to 400cc. The Pulsar range managed to hit the first one crore sales mark in seventeen years, whereas the second crore came up in a rather short span of six years. Bajaj claims that Pulsar is a market leader in over twenty countries out of the fifty countries it is sold in. To celebrate this milestone, Bajaj is offering discounts on select models– starting with the Pulsar 125, witnessing the lowest discount of Rs 1,184, bringing its price down to Rs 84,493. Meanwhile, the iconic but dated Pulsar 220F has seen the highest price cut of over Rs 7,300 in states like Maharashtra, Bihar and West Bengal. Bajaj has also increased the price of the N160 twin disc variant by Rs 1,000, now priced at Rs 1.23 lakh. Currently, the range starts from Rs 81,400 for the Pulsar 125 and goes up to Rs 1.84 lakh for the flagship Pulsar NS400Z.  Bajaj Pulsar discountModelPricePrice differencePulsar 125 NeonRs 84,493Rs 1,184Pulsar 125 Carbon FibreRs 91,610Rs 2,000Pulsar 150 Single DiscRs 1.13 lakhRs 3,000Pulsar 150 Twin DiscRs 1.20 lakhRs 3,000Pulsar N160 USDRs 1.37 lakhRs 5,811Pulsar NS125 BaseRs 1 lakhunchangedPulsar NS125 ABSRs 1.07 lakhunchangedPulsar N160 TD Single SeatRs 1.23 lakhPrice increased by Rs 1,000Pulsar 220FRs 1.44 lakhRs 7379 discount in Maharashtra, Bihar & WB Only All prices ex-showroom, Delhi
author: Autocar India News Desk

html:
Launched in 2001, the Pulsar range has reached its second crore worth of sales in just six years.

The Bajaj Pulsar range has crossed the 2 crore sales milestone across 50 countries and to celebrate this milestone, Bajaj is offering discounts of up to Rs 7,300 on selected models. 

  1. Pulsar 220F enjoys the highest price cut
  2. Pulsar N160 TD single seat price increased by Rs 1,000

Bajaj Pulsar hits 2 crore sales milestone

Bajaj is offering discounts on select models

The Bajaj Pulsar made its debut in 2001, revolutionizing India’s budget performance segment. It initially launched with 150cc and 180cc models, which were considered high-performance at the time, given that most other offerings ranged between 100-125cc. Over the years, the Pulsar lineup has grown significantly, and today, it boasts a diverse range of twelve models, spanning from 125cc to 400cc.

The Pulsar range managed to hit the first one crore sales mark in seventeen years, whereas the second crore came up in a rather short span of six years. Bajaj claims that Pulsar is a market leader in over twenty countries out of the fifty countries it is sold in.

To celebrate this milestone, Bajaj is offering discounts on select models– starting with the Pulsar 125, witnessing the lowest discount of Rs 1,184, bringing its price down to Rs 84,493. Meanwhile, the iconic but dated Pulsar 220F has seen the highest price cut of over Rs 7,300 in states like Maharashtra, Bihar and West Bengal. Bajaj has also increased the price of the N160 twin disc variant by Rs 1,000, now priced at Rs 1.23 lakh.

Currently, the range starts from Rs 81,400 for the Pulsar 125 and goes up to Rs 1.84 lakh for the flagship Pulsar NS400Z.
